definition[0]: used to emphasize that you will not agree or be able to do something
example[0]: ‘Are you going to offer to work over the weekend?’ ‘No way!’
example[1]: No way will we be finished by five o'clock.
example[2]: There’s no way I’m going to pay £500 just for a weekend in Paris.
definition[1]: used to say that you will definitely not do or allow something
note[0]: No way José! (=used to emphasize that you will not do something)
example[4]: There’s no way I’ll ever get married again.
definition[2]: used to say that you do not believe something or are very surprised by it
